alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 9:36AM EST until January 06 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Macon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.7 feet, Minor flooding continues. The Macon Greenway Ocmulgee Heritage Trail will continue to flood in areas just north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The public should not use this portion of the trail. In addition...the lowest sections of the Charles Jones Gateway Park will flood. Portions of agricultural lands well downstream will be under two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Tuesday was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 12.8 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.8 feet on 03/02/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
